meanings.sent1: In the past, people would hire fiacres for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The fiacres lined up outside the event venue, waiting for customers.
meanings.sent3: The fiacres had a race to see who could reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The fiacres moved through the streets like elegant carriages from a fairytale.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the fiacres trotting along the cobblestone roads was enchanting.

meanings.definition: A type of carriage used in France.
meanings.sent1: The fiacres in France were known for their stylish design.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often took rides in the traditional fiacres to explore the city.
meanings.sent3: The fiacres in Paris had a French flag waving on top for decoration.
meanings.sent4: The fiacres symbolized the charm and romance of old-world France.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hooves clattering on the pavement signaled the arrival of the fiacres.

meanings.sent1: The fiacres in the city were always in high demand during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: People hailed fiacres to quickly get to their destinations.
meanings.sent3: The fiacres had a friendly competition to see who could pick up the most passengers.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the fiacres stood out among the sea of cars on the road.
meanings.sent5: The drivers of the fiacres knew all the shortcuts to avoid traffic jams.
